text:
April 2020
Volume 36 | Number 8
Special Edition
New York State Medicaid Program Launches Online Medicaid
Provider Enrollment During COVID-19 Public Health Emergency
The health and safety of New York State’s health care workforce and the ability to provide and support
patient care remain priorities. This system upgrade offers an improved and more streamlined process
for providers interested in offering Medicaid services.
Pursuant to section 1135(b)(1)(B) of the Social Security Act, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid
Services (CMS) has allowed states to temporarily waive and/or suspend some of the requirements for
providers who wish to temporarily enroll in fee-for-service (FFS) Medicaid for the purpose of assisting
with the COVID-19 public health emergency. As a result, and to expedite and simplify the enrollment
process, the Department of Health’s Bureau of Provider Enrollment has taken action to implement
the following:
(i) Create an online Provisional Temporary Provider Enrollment application process that
allows physicians, registered physician assistants (RPAs), nurse practitioners (NPs),
registered nurses (RNs), and licensed practical nurses (LPNs) to enroll on a temporary b

enrolled in Medicare or another state’s Medicaid program if the
requested data is provided on the Provisional Temporary Provider Enrollment application and
the provider: 1) is not currently excluded from NYS Medicaid; 2) does not appear on the Office
of Inspector General (OIG) Exclusions Database; and 3) is licensed and legally authorized to
practice or deliver the service for which they file claims in at least one state or territory.
Continued on page 3

Special Edition: COVID-19 Provider Enrollment Guidance New York State Medicaid Update pg. 2

The Provisional Temporary Provider Enrollment (PTPE) Process
PTPE is only available for the duration of the public health emergency. Once the designation is
lifted, PTPEs will cease, and providers enrolled under this process will be required to complete the full
application process or will be terminated from the NY Medicaid program.
PTPE is ONLY available to providers in the following Categories of Service (COS):
• Nurse LPN – 0521
• Nurse RN – 0522
• Nurse Practitioner – 0469
• Physician – 0460
• Physician Assistant (Registered) – 0462
Before completing any PTPE application, the PENDING PROVIDERS LIST or ENROLLED
PRACTIONERS SEARCH (click on underlined links) must be reviewed to ensure the provider is not
already enrolled in New York State Medicaid. If the provider appea

S SEARCH (click on underlined links) must be reviewed to ensure the provider is not
already enrolled in New York State Medicaid. If the provider appears on either list, the provider does not
need to enroll under this process. Please note that submitting applications for providers who are already
enrolled will divert resources from processing the applications of providers who do need to enroll.
PTPE Enrollment
For each of below described PTPE enrollment options, the following information is required:
• Provider’s/credentialer’s email address
• Provider’s responses to the disclosure questions
• Category of Service (COS)
• Provider’s SSN
• Name of state where provider is licensed for the COS on application
• License number
• Provider’s NPI
• Provider’s date of birth
• Provider phone numbers: cell, work
• For physicians, NPs, and RPAs only, if affiliated to a group, the group name, group NPI, and
whether the provider also has a private practice
• Home address (optional), correspondence address, pay-to address, taxpayer address, and
name and address of service location
Please Note: If any of the above information is missing or not available, processing of the application
will be delayed

nd address of service location
Please Note: If any of the above information is missing or not available, processing of the application
will be delayed.
For each of the PTPE enrollment options (1-4), providers are required to answer standard enrollment
disclosure questions. A provider who answers “yes” to ANY disclosure question, or a provider who
currently appears on the NYS excluded provider list and is seeking reinstatement, cannot enroll using
the PTPE process but rather is required to complete and submit both the full paper application and the
Prior Conduct Questionnaire.
It is important to note that upon processing of the PTPE application, a written determination of approval
or denial will be sent to the correspondence address.
Special Edition: COVID-19 Provider Enrollment Guidance New York State Medicaid Update pg. 3

Options for Submitting PTPE Applications
Option 1 - To Enroll Using the Online Form:
1. An online form for both billing and OPRA providers can be accessed at:
www.emedny.org/COVID19/.
2. Instructions for completing and submitting the online form are found below the link to the form on
the website.
3. To complete the online application process, the provider must

and submitting the online form are found below the link to the form on
the website.
3. To complete the online application process, the provider must click "Submit."
Option 2 - To Enroll Using Email:
1. The Department has created fillable PDFs of the Practitioner Enrollment Form (billing providers)
and the OPRA Enrollment Form (ordering, prescribing, referring, and/or attending providers) that
are available at: www.emedny.org/COVID19/.
2. Only certain fields are required to be completed. Please be sure to refer to the instructions found
directly below the PDF links.
3. Completed forms should be saved, attached to an email, and forwarded for processing to:
emednycovid19PE@csra.com.
Option 3 - To Enroll an Individual Provider by Telephone:
To complete an application by telephone, providers and/or credentialers are asked to contact the
eMedNY Call Center at (800) 343-9000, menu option 2, sub option 4. If enrolling by telephone, the
required provider-specific information (listed above) must be available before calling.
Option 4 - To Enroll Multiple Providers:
• Credentialers who are enrolling multiple providers must contact the eMedNY Call Center at 800-
343-9000 for assistance. A spre

l Multiple Providers:
• Credentialers who are enrolling multiple providers must contact the eMedNY Call Center at 800-
343-9000 for assistance. A spreadsheet will be provided by eMedNY, and the credentialer must
complete the required fields for each provider who is applying for PTPE.
• Credentialers must check the PENDING PROVIDERS LIST or perform the ENROLLED
PRACTIONERS SEARCH (click on either underlined link) for each provider to make sure the
provider is not already enrolled. If the provider appears on either list, the provider does not need
to enroll under this process. Please note that submitting applications for providers who are
already enrolled will divert resources from processing the applications of providers who do need
to enroll.
Option 5 - Online Provider Portal In Development:
Prior to the COVID-19 emergency, the Department was working on developing an online provider portal
to replace the existing paper-based enrollment process and fully automate provider enrollment for all
providers. In response to the current public health emergency, the Department refocused this
development initiative to quickly implement provisional temporary enrollments. The option for full
enr

health emergency, the Department refocused this
development initiative to quickly implement provisional temporary enrollments. The option for full
enrollment through the Online Provider Portal is in development. Please check the Provider Enrollment
tab on the eMedNY website regularly for updates on this option, as well as other pertinent information
related to provider enrollment activities during this emergency.
Questions about Provisional Temporary Provider Enrollment:
• Questions related to this guidance should be sent to providerenrollment@health.ny.gov. Please
include “COVID-19” in the subject line.
• Questions related specifically to completing or submitting PTPE applications should be directed
to the eMedNY Call Center at (800) 343-9000 or emednyCOVID19BPE@csra.com.
Special Edition: COVID-19 Provider Enrollment Guidance New York State Medicaid Update pg. 4

For questions about billing and performing MEVS transactions:

Provider Training:
To sign up for a provider seminar, please enroll online at https://www.emedny.org/training/
index.aspx. For individual training requests, please call (800) 343-9000.
Beneficiary Eligibility:
Call the Touchtone Telephone Verification System at (800) 997-1111.
Medicaid Prescriber Education Program:
For current information on best practices in pharmacotherapy, please visit the following websites:
http://www.health.ny.gov/health_care/medicaid/program/prescriber_education/presc-educationprog
https://nypep.nysdoh.suny.edu/

For a number of services including: change of address, updating an enrollment file due to an

https://www.emedny.org/info/ProviderE

ent file due to an
ownership change, enrolling another NPI, or revalidating an existing enrollment please visit:

based on provider type.
Medicaid Electronic Health Record (EHR) Incentive Program:
Contact the New York Medicaid EHR Call Center at (877) 646-5410.
Comments and/or suggestions regarding this publication:
